result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lonnell Smith

4:12 PM Defendant Lonnell Smith appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael A. Forella III appeared by video for Lonnell Smith.  Attorney Joel N Urmanski in court for State of Wisconsin. Defense bond motion to modify to a signature bond or cash no more than $350 total additional for all cases. Court suggests defense have a treatment plan and then address bond for release to a facility. Court denies bond motion in this case. Set for trial. WL, MIL and prop jury instructions due 12/5/22.

2:11 PM Defendant Lonnell Smith appeared by phone.  Attorney Grant D Scaife in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michael A. Forella III appeared by video for Lonnell Smith. Bond motion filed by the State due to GPS violation. State is in compliance w/victim's rights. Atty Forella and defendant go into a break out room to review today's day report.  2:24 PM back on the record. State requests an increase of cash bond by an additional $3,000.  Defense requests no cash increase.  Atty Forella is new to the case. Court increases the cash bond to $2,250.00 w/same conditions. To be posted/signed by 4:30PM today.  Warrant to issue if not paid or deft fails to turn self in at the DC.
